Last week, I had the opportunity to visit the Baobab concentrator. And this moment captured in time spoke volumes about the evolution of our industry. This photograph, showcasing a team of female metallurgists and technical experts, is a powerful emblem of progress and the remarkable contributions of women in mining. These professionals are not just filling roles; they are redefining them. They are trailblazers who are driving innovation, fine-tuning efficiencies, and rethinking what it means to be leaders in operational excellence. Each brings a distinct perspective to our collective table, enriching our workplace with diverse insights and experiences. They serve as mentors, pioneers, leaders, and peers, embodying the very essence of teamwork and skill. Their presence not only strengthens our operational backbone but also underscores the importance of diversity for the advancement and prosperity of our sector. Against the backdrop of the Baobab concentrator‚Äôs robust machinery, these women apply their knowledge and skills, transforming challenges into achievements, and raw minerals into valuable commodities. The work is complex and arduous, yet their dedication is steadfast, and their capabilities are clear and impactful. As we applaud their contributions and continue to champion inclusive practices, we must also recognize the distance still to go. Our commitment to empowering more women to join, excel, and lead in the mining field remains unwavering. Because championing women in mining isn't just about supporting individuals; it's about enriching our entire industry for the better. ü•Ç Here‚Äôs to the women of the Baobab concentrator, and all women in mining, for their relentless pursuit of excellence, their expertise, and the exceptional value they add at every level of operation. Celebrating International Day of Women in Mining Today, June 15th, we honour the trailblazing women of DGC Africa who are shaping the future of the mining industry. Despite historical challenges and barriers, these incredible women continue to excel in exploration, extraction, processing, and management, driving us toward a more sustainable and inclusive future. As we mark International Day of Women in Mining, we recognize not only the vital contributions of women in our field but also the ongoing need to foster an environment where every woman has the opportunity to thrive. From advocating for equitable policies to nurturing networks for support and mentorship, DGC Africa is committed to empowering every woman to reach her full potential. Join us in celebrating these extraordinary professionals and their achievements. Together, we're not just mining minerals; we're mining untapped potential and building a brighter, more equitable future. #WomenInMining #GenderEquality #SustainableMining #DGCAfrica

The women in mining recently concluded the local celebrations of Women in Mining, underscored by two powerful themes. At the international level, the theme was "I am Mining and I Belong," while the local celebration in Nigeria focused on "Trailblazers in Mining: Two Decades of Resilience, Innovation, and Achievement." The conference provided a platform to discuss critical issues such as creating awareness and mentoring the next generation of women in mining. Participants shared strategies to combat stereotypes and address harassment from other genders, aiming to foster a more inclusive and supportive environment for women in the industry. We were honored to have the presence and support of: - @Barbara Darshinger - @Tope Adeyoju - WIM Angola - WIM Madagascar - WIM Ghana Additionally, the support from international organizations such as IWIM, AWIMA, West Africa Women in Mining, and more, was invaluable. These discussions are vital as we work together to break down barriers and build a future where women are empowered, respected, and fully integrated into all aspects of mining. The shared experiences and solutions presented at the conference are a testament to our collective resilience and commitment to change. #WomenInMining #MiningDiversity #FutureOfMining #InclusiveMining #EmpowermentInMining #IWIM #AWIMA #WestAfricaWomenInMining #IAmMiningAndIBelong #TrailblazersInMining #TwoDecadesOfResilienceInnovationAchievement

Maisori Mahende, one of our dedicated employees at Geita Gold Mining Limited (GGML), a subsidiary of AngloGold Ashanti, embodies the spirit of determination and resilience. Her journey in mining is a testament to the power of self-confidence and the importance of supportive leadership. Maisori's story is not just hers; it's a story shared by many women who are breaking barriers and paving the way for future generations in mining. It hasn't always been an easy journey. Maisori faced challenges where her abilities were questioned simply because of her gender. But she persevered, supported by leaders who believed in her potential and an unshakeable self-confidence that merited respect. It's important to dispel the myths that surround our industry. Mining isn't just for men; it's a field ripe with opportunities for women seeking rewarding careers with opportunities for advancement. At GGML, we want to lead the way in raising awareness and ensuring that women know that a career in mining is within their reach and that it's a goal worth pursuing. #IWD2024 #Inclusion #Diversity #MiningforNationalDevelopment #agatanzania #MiningforDevelopment #miningforchange #mining #mininglife #miningtanzania #tanzania #SustainableGrowth #Sustainability #CorporateSocialResponsibility #CommunityDevelopment Maisori Peter Mahende
